comments:
in i0118

I had a class in some package in some project. 
- In the package explorer I selected the package and copied (ctrl c).
- I selected the src folder in another project and pasted (ctrl v)
- this resulted in the package being pasted in but there were several empty 
packages created of the form org.eclipse.swt.CVS, 
org.eclipse.swt.internal.CVS, ...
- I tried to delete these packages by selcting and using the menu "delete" 
action but this resulted in an error saying that the CVS file does not exist. 
(see stack trace from log)
- this is in fact true but that's kind of the point.  It does not exist so 
there shouldn't be a package.

- not sure if this should be an LTK or JDT thing so...

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 368 2005-01-20 17:17:31.269
!MESSAGE Resource /org.eclipse.pde.build/src/org/eclipse/swt/CVS does not exist.
The only way to recover from this state is to open/close the project.

To reproduce:
1. Check out org.eclipse.osgi
2. Open a Windows Explorer on this project
3. Select folder 'org' in 'console/src'
4. Copy
5. Go to the Package Explorer
6. Select 'resolver/src'
7. Paste
Observe: a package ending with .CVS is also added

Close/reopen the project fixes the problem
